title: meta: RFC 9000 QUIC Transport Protocol Implementation Tracking
body:
## RFC 9000 - QUIC: A UDP-Based Multiplexed and Secure Transport

This issue tracks the implementation of [RFC 9000](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9000) for the tetsuo-socket library.

## Implementation Order

Issues are ordered by dependencies. Complete in sequence:

### Tier 0: Foundational (No Dependencies)
| # | Issue | Section | Complexity | Est. Lines |
|---|-------|---------|------------|------------|
| 1 | #377 | §16 Variable-Length Integers | LOW | ~100 |
| 2 | #378 | §20 Error Codes | TRIVIAL | ~50 |
| 3 | #379 | §15 Version Constants | TRIVIAL | ~50 |

### Tier 1: Core Infrastructure
| # | Issue | Section | Depends On | Complexity |
|---|-------|---------|------------|------------|
| 4 | #380 | §5.1 Connection IDs | #377 | MEDIUM |
| 5 | #381 | Appendix A Packet Number Encoding | #377 | LOW |
| 6 | #382 | §17 Packet Formats | #377 | HIGH |

### Tier 2: Packet Handling
| # | Issue | Section | Depends On | Complexity |
|---|-------|---------|------------|------------|
| 7 | #383 | §6 Version Negotiation | #379, #382 | LOW |
| 8 | #384 | §12 Packets and Frames | #377, #382 | HIGH |
| 9 | #385 | §18 Transport Parameters | #377, #382 | HIGH |
| 10 | #386 | §2 Streams | #377, #380 | MEDIUM |
| 11 | #387 | §17.2.2 Initial Packet | #377, #380, #382 | HIGH |

### Tier 3: Frame Types
| # | Issue | Section | Depends On | Complexity |
|---|-------|---------|------------|------------|
| 12 | #388 | §19.1-19.3 PADDING/PING/ACK | #377, #384 | MEDIUM |
| 13 | #389 | §19.4-19.5 RESET_STREAM/STOP_SENDING | #384, #386 | MEDIUM |
| 14 | #390 | §19.6 CRYPTO Frame | #377, #384 | MEDIUM |
| 15 | #391 | §19.7 NEW_TOKEN Frame | #377, #384 | LOW |
| 16 | #392 | §19.8 STREAM Frame | #377, #384, #386 | HIGH |
| 17 | #393 | §19.9-19.11 MAX Frames | #377, #384 | MEDIUM |
| 18 | #394 | §19.12-19.14 BLOCKED Frames | #377, #384 | MEDIUM |
| 19 | #395 | §19.15-19.16 Connection ID Frames | #377, #380, #384 | MEDIUM |
| 20 | #396 | §19.17-19.18 PATH Frames | #384 | MEDIUM |
| 21 | #397 | §19.19 CONNECTION_CLOSE | #377, #378, #384 | MEDIUM |
| 22 | #398 | §19.20 HANDSHAKE_DONE | #384 | LOW |

### Tier 4: Higher-Level Features
| # | Issue | Section | Depends On | Complexity |
|---|-------|---------|------------|------------|
| 23 | #399 | §3 Stream States | #386, #389, #392 | HIGH |
| 24 | #400 | §4 Flow Control | #386, #393, #394 | MEDIUM |
| 25 | #401 | §5.1.1-5.1.2 Connection ID Operations | #380, #395 | HIGH |
| 26 | #402 | §5.2-5.3 Packet-Connection Matching | #380, #382, #401 | HIGH |
| 27 | #403 | §11 Error Handling | #378, #389, #397 | MEDIUM |

### Tier 5: Complex Features
| # | Issue | Section | Depends On | Complexity |
|---|-------|---------|------------|------------|
| 28 | #404 | §7 Cryptographic Handshake | #385, #387, #390 | VERY HIGH |
| 29 | #407 | §13 Packetization/Reliability | #382, #384, #388 | VERY HIGH |
| 30 | #408 | §14 Datagram Size/PMTU | #382, #384 | HIGH |

### Tier 6: Advanced Features
| # | Issue | Section | Depends On | Complexity |
|---|-------|---------|------------|------------|
| 31 | #405 | §8 Address Validation | #391, #396, #404 | HIGH |
| 32 | #406 | §10 Connection Termination | #397, #404 | HIGH |

### Tier 7: Final Feature
| # | Issue | Section | Depends On | Complexity |
|---|-------|---------|------------|------------|
| 33 | #409 | §9 Connection Migration | #396, #400, #401, #405 | VERY HIGH |

## Progress Checklist

### Foundational
- [ ] #377 - Variable-Length Integers
- [ ] #378 - Error Codes
- [ ] #379 - Version Constants

### Core Infrastructure
- [ ] #380 - Connection IDs
- [ ] #381 - Packet Number Encoding
- [ ] #382 - Packet Formats

### Packet Handling
- [ ] #383 - Version Negotiation
- [ ] #384 - Packets and Frames
- [ ] #385 - Transport Parameters
- [ ] #386 - Streams
- [ ] #387 - Initial Packet

### Frame Types
- [ ] #388 - PADDING/PING/ACK
- [ ] #389 - RESET_STREAM/STOP_SENDING
- [ ] #390 - CRYPTO Frame
- [ ] #391 - NEW_TOKEN Frame
- [ ] #392 - STREAM Frame
- [ ] #393 - MAX Frames
- [ ] #394 - BLOCKED Frames
- [ ] #395 - Connection ID Frames
- [ ] #396 - PATH Frames
- [ ] #397 - CONNECTION_CLOSE
- [ ] #398 - HANDSHAKE_DONE

### Higher-Level Features
- [ ] #399 - Stream States
- [ ] #400 - Flow Control
- [ ] #401 - Connection ID Operations
- [ ] #402 - Packet-Connection Matching
- [ ] #403 - Error Handling

### Complex Features
- [ ] #404 - Cryptographic Handshake
- [ ] #407 - Packetization/Reliability
- [ ] #408 - Datagram Size/PMTU

### Advanced Features
- [ ] #405 - Address Validation
- [ ] #406 - Connection Termination
- [ ] #409 - Connection Migration

## Statistics

| Complexity | Count | Est. Total Lines |
|------------|-------|------------------|
| TRIVIAL | 2 | ~100 |
| LOW | 6 | ~700 |
| MEDIUM | 13 | ~3,500 |
| HIGH | 9 | ~5,400 |
| VERY HIGH | 3 | ~4,500 |
| **TOTAL** | **33** | **~14,200** |

## Module Structure

New directory structure:
```
include/quic/
├── SocketQUIC.h              # Main header, version, errors
├── SocketQUICVarInt.h        # Variable-length integers
├── SocketQUICConnectionID.h  # Connection ID management
├── SocketQUICPacket.h        # Packet parsing/serialization
├── SocketQUICFrame.h         # Frame types
├── SocketQUICStream.h        # Stream abstraction
├── SocketQUICFlow.h          # Flow control
├── SocketQUICHandshake.h     # TLS 1.3 handshake
├── SocketQUICTransportParams.h
├── SocketQUICMigration.h     # Path migration
└── SocketQUICPMTU.h          # Path MTU discovery

src/quic/
├── SocketQUICVarInt.c
├── SocketQUICConnectionID.c
├── SocketQUICPacket.c
├── SocketQUICPacket-initial.c
├── SocketQUICFrame.c
├── SocketQUICFrame-ack.c
├── SocketQUICFrame-stream.c
├── SocketQUICStream.c
├── SocketQUICStream-state.c
├── SocketQUICFlow.c
├── SocketQUICHandshake.c
├── SocketQUICConnection.c
├── SocketQUICConnection-demux.c
├── SocketQUICConnection-termination.c
├── SocketQUICMigration.c
├── SocketQUICPMTU.c
└── SocketQUICAck.c
```

## Related RFCs

- **RFC 9000** - QUIC Transport (this RFC)
- **RFC 9001** - Using TLS to Secure QUIC
- **RFC 9002** - Loss Detection and Congestion Control
- **RFC 9114** - HTTP/3

## References

- [RFC 9000 Full Text](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9000)
- [QUIC Working Group](https://quicwg.org/)
- Similar patterns in codebase: `src/http/SocketHTTP2*.c`, `src/tls/SocketDTLS.c`
